meanings.definition: A man granted an honorary title of knighthood by a monarch or other political leader.
meanings.sent1: The knights protected the kingdom with honor and bravery.
meanings.sent2: In the medieval times, knights were respected for their chivalry.
meanings.sent3: The knights rode into battle on their noble steeds, ready to defend the realm.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as her knight in shining armor, always there to rescue her.
meanings.sent5: The image of knights in shining armor is often romanticized in stories and legends.

meanings.definition: A chess piece, typically representing a warrior on horseback.
meanings.sent1: The knights in chess move in an L-shape on the board.
meanings.sent2: Capturing the opponent's knights can change the course of the game.
meanings.sent3: The knight in chess is known for its unique way of moving across the board.
meanings.sent4: She strategically placed her knight to protect her king from checkmate.
meanings.sent5: The knight in chess symbolizes a powerful and versatile piece on the board.

meanings.sent1: He knights his loyal squire as a gesture of gratitude.
meanings.sent2: The queen will knight the brave soldier for his valor in battle.
meanings.sent3: In the ceremony, he will knight the young page with a swift tap on the shoulder.
meanings.sent4: She decided to knight him for his exceptional service to the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The king will knight the nobleman in a grand ceremony at the castle.
